elements.content: <ce:section-title>Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para id="spara10" view="all">The self-assembly of 5-bromoisophthalic acid (H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>BIPA) with Eu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O under the hydrothermal conditions gave a 3D coordination polymer, Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(BIPA)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>OH) (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>), which was characterized by elemental analysis, IR and single-crystal X-ray diffraction. Complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> displayed an unusual three-dimensional network of a rare (4,6)-connected (4<ce:sup loc="post">8</ce:sup>.6<ce:sup loc="post">6</ce:sup>.8)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(4<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>.6<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(4<ce:sup loc="post">2</ce:sup>.8<ce:sup loc="post">4</ce:sup>) topology, which was different from Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(BDC)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (BDC=isophthalate), because the -Br substituent of the isophthalate resulted in the different electronic effects and the steric hindrance to change the coordination modes of carboxylate groups in the assembled process. Moreover, the luminescent properties of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were also investigated in the solid state.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

The self-assembly of 5-bromoisophthalic acid (H2BIPA) with Eu(NO3)3⋅6H2O under the hydrothermal conditions gave a 3D coordination polymer, Eu2(BIPA)3(CH3CH2OH) (1), which was characterized by elemental analysis, IR and single-crystal X-ray diffraction. Complex 1 displayed an unusual three-dimensional network of a rare (4,6)-connected (48.66.8)2(44.62)2(42.84) topology, which was different from Eu2(BDC)3(H2O)2 (BDC=isophthalate), because the -Br substituent of the isophthalate resulted in the different electronic effects and the steric hindrance to change the coordination modes of carboxylate groups in the assembled process. Moreover, the luminescent properties of 1 were also investigated in the solid state.

metadata.title: Synthesis, structure and photoluminescent properties of a new Eu(III) complex with 5-bromoisophthalic acid
metadata.journal: The Chinese Society of Rare Earths. Published by Elsevier B.V.
